choices.text:
write a Python function to do a case insensitive sort of a list of strings
Sure, here is one way you can write it.  It uses the built-in sorted() method that takes an optional key argument which specifies how to compare two items in your sequence (the default being lexicographical order). The following code will perform this sorting on any string type objects and return a new list:
sorted(list_of_strings,key=lambda x :x.lower())
